title: For Sale/Trade:  ANTIQUE REVOLVER
postcontent:
THIS GUN WAS MADE BEFORE 1899 AND IS CONSIDERED AN ANTIQUE, THEREFORE IS NOT CONSIDERED A FIREARM. CHECK YOU LOCAL LAWS AND LISTINGS.


This is a 5-shot top break .32 revolver. The timing is perfect. It is in excellent condition, there is no rust on it, barely any patina. It looks like a large gun but it is actually very small and compact, no longer than most cell phones and has a smaller profile than most wheel guns. The barrel is about 3 inches long.

Despite being an antique, this gun is actually very modular.

This is due to it being top break, so unlike most revolvers, it is very easy to change out the barrel and cylinder.

You could shoot .32 ACP out of it so long as it was lead ammo, and not FMJ.

There are tons of parts for it on ebay. You could get a spare snub nose barrel and a spare hammer, then grind the spur down to make it the ultimate carry gun, you could get a cylinder and barrel set chambered in .38, which you could also probably shoot lead .380 out of.

You could even get a .22 barrel and cylinder for it.

TEXT 304-224-9162 (6am - 10pm preferred)

Or call the same number (4pm - 8pm ONLY!!!)

title: For Sale:  Remington 700 .308 SPS Tactical...ish
postcontent: Started out as a Remington 700 .308 SPS Tactical AAC-SD with the 20" 1 in 10 twist heavy threaded barrel.  Came with the Hogue stock which I didnt really like the color of and the X-Mark Pro Trigger that is actually really nice once adjusted down.  I have always wanted a sexy rifle and that was my goal in mind when I started building it.  First to go was the stock which was changed to the Bell & Carlson Medalist which is fully adjustable. Second was a scope that ended up proving a point I read on the internet (a decent scope is only a doorway to an expensive scope LOL).  Long story short, I purchased a Nightforce 20 MOA 1 peice scope mount and a Sightron SIII 10-50x60 scope.  I LOVE THIS SCOPE!  It is clean and reaches WAAAY out!.  I spend half the time at the range spotting for my friends.  I then got a cheap bipod that just didnt look right so again, found what I should have gotten in the first place.  Atlas Bipod BT10-LW17...is it wrong to get excited about a bipod?? Because this thing is awesome!! I got the one with the quick attach/release lever which also required a short weaver rail on the bottom slide of the stock.  New was to get ride of the thread cover so I got a Yankee Hill Machine Muzzle Brake.  It lives in a Pelican Storm Case.  I love this weapon and want to see it go to a loving home.  Face to face cash only please.  I'm not really interested in any trades.

title: For Sale:   ULTIMATE SAIGA CQB 12 SHOTGUN BUILT
postcontent: AS FAR AS SAIGA'S GO THIS IS THE BATTLE VERSION. The Saiga-12 IZ- 433 is a 030-type semi-automatic shotgun based on the famous design of standard Saiga IZ-109. The shotgun is equipped with a magazine guide (magwell) and an automatic last round bolt hold open device in order to help facilitate easy reloads and insertion of the magazine. It also has a self regulating gas system, which allows greater flexibility in the type of ammo used. The top cover features a Picatinny rail on top allowing various optical devices to be attached to aid in target acquisition. The top cover is also hinged to the rear sight block in order to provide the top-mounted Picatinny rail with the ability to hold zero. An adjustable rear notched sight and front sight post are also standard on the shotgun to assist in accurate firing when no optical device is affixed.

title: For Sale:  Springfield Armory M1A Scout
postcontent:
Well, time to sell my scout. I am the original owner, exactly 155 rounds fired. Includes box and paperwork.  Details:

Scout rail was removed to improve accuracy.
Hand guard was replaced with a Fulton Armory heavy duty guard.
Compensator was replaced with an original USGI birdcage flash suppressor.
SAI plastic stock was replaced with a vintage USGI H&R walnut stock.
Sadlak extended mag release was installed by the local gunsmith.
"F" prefixed forged bolt.

This rifle is in outstanding shape and shoots very well. Absolutely 100% reliability. No marring or handling marks anywhere on the rifle (except for the 50 year old Vietnam era stock). It has been properly cared for, and really isn't even broken in yet. The stock locks up very tight, eliminating any play in the action. It was a major upgrade from the original. Factory 10-round magazine is included. Extra mags and ammo available on request. I also have a Sadlak scope mount for $100 extra. I just never got around to mounting it. 

Attached target was from the range last weekend. 5 round group was shot with Prvi 168gr match.

Asking $1500 cash. FTF only in Manhattan, KS. Will not ship rifle.

postcontent:
10 New boxes of Federal's Black Cloud Snow Goose Load,  12 GA, 3 inch mag, 1 1/8 ounce of BB's at 1635fps.   The shells are new in mint condition, protected from humidity and temperature. I used some in Canada before on a 1 week goose hunt in western Saskatchewan, and it absolutely knocks the crap out of all geese.  I doubled on specs, meaning I got two with one shot, and the shot was 40-45 yards. This is great stuff. It knocks down honkers as well (Greater Canada's).  This is top of the line stuff, I just need some extra cash to go towards a gun purchase. These rounds cost about $190-$200 or more for a case. I will let this one go for $150 plus shipping, or if you are local, you can pick them up for $150.  

NOTE:  I also have 150 rounds of Federal's High Density (denser than lead or Hevi-Shot) in 12 GA, 3 inch mag,  1 3/8 ounce of 4's at 1450 fps. These are made of Tungsten Iron, they come 10 to a box. I will sell them at $20/box, or $275 takes them all. Plus add the shipping if I send them to you. This stuff is better than Hevi-Shot. 

RIFLE AMMO:  325 WSM,  Winchester Supreme CPX3 (for elk/moose)  , 200 grain Nosler Accubonds, premium ammunition.  5 boxes of 20, plus 12 more rounds. It is lubalox coated, which is not moly, it reduces fouling, raises the ballistic coefficient slightly (a good thing), and doesn't leave a residue in the barrel. This ammo sells for $69-$72 box new. I will sell these at a deal at $50/box, plus throw in some once fired brass.  So the price is $275, plus shipping, and you get an extra 28 rounds of nickel plated brass with it, just in case you reload now or start reloading in the future. Brass for a 325 WSM is $1- $3 per round depending on who you get it from. This is all premium stuff, and it's at a deal. 

I also have 22 LR ammo, so ask about that if interested.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Smith & Wesson M&P 9mm RANGE KIT
postcontent:
Full size 4.25” barrel, melonite steel slide, polymer frame, striker fire action, white dot sights. Manufactured in 2012 and has the newer barrel design. If you know about the M&P’s, the earlier models were having issues with accuracy and S&W changed the barrels to a 1:10 twist that gives it Glock-like performance. This one has no side lock or safety. Looks almost new. Less than 200 rounds through it. I bought it last year hoping I could get into these modern polymer guns but realized it’s just not my cup of tea (I shoot revolvers.) I'm still not sure if I want to sell but am asking $535 and may consider trade offers.

These M&P Range Kits are a little harder to find and come with a lot of nice extras that you don't get in the basic setup. The magazines alone are worth it. Includes:
• Charcoal/Black Case (instead of the blue. These come for Range Kit only)
• Three 17-round magazines
• Three interchangeable backstraps (small, medium, large)
• Blade-Tech Kydex Holster
• Blade-Tech Double Magazine Pouch
• Mag Uplula Speed Loader (
• Original Manuals/Papers

*Important: You must have a valid North Carolina CCW license or Pistol Purchase Permit. I'll have us both sign a bill of sale. No exceptions. If ad is still up it means it has not sold yet.

title: For Sale:  Colt .45 ACP Series 70 Government Custom Shop Special Run New in Box O1970A1CS Govt Model 1911 Series 45 Automatic Blue & Rosewood
postcontent: Colt Series 70 Government Model that occasional comes in a limited run from the Colt Custom Shop only. The forte of the Series 70, of course, is the lack of a firing pin block or firing pin safety, and the crisp single action trigger pull that only comes without the trigger having to depress a plunger. Factory specs are as follows. The pistol is the classic 5 inch barrel all-steel Colt Series 70 Government, catalog #O1970A1CS .45 ACP. It's entirely blue steel, 8 1/2 inches overall length, classic spur hammer, aluminum combat trigger, flat black combat sights, with classic Double Diamond Rosewood Colt grips. Both grip safety and thumb safety are standard configuration. Serrated trigger is standard, and it has two factory 7 shot magazines. Finish, as the photos show, is matte blue vertical surfaces with classic Colt bright blue side features. The pistol speaks for itself. Each one comes in its original blue box with its padlock, extra magazine, and instruction manual.

title: For Sale:   SIG SAUER® P250
postcontent:
The P250®, a modular pistol that allows the shooter to change caliber and size at will.... The SIG SAUER® P250 was designed specifically to address the future needs of the military, law enforcement, and civilian shooters around the world. The P250 is available in the most popular calibers (9mm, .40S&W and .45ACP). The P250's innovative design enables the shooter to quickly remove the functional mechanism and place it into the polymer grip of his choice. This allows an immediate change in caliber and size;(subcompact, compact and full). And after any change the pistol delivers both outstanding accuracy and reliable functionality. Unlike other polymer based pistols the steel frame on the P250 controls the rearward motion of the slide- not the polymer grip. The result is both outstanding accuracy and reliable functionality even with lasers, lights, or other accessories mounted to the polymer grip's molded in accessory rail.

 Now you can own the world's only modular shooting system globally engineered to deliver the "To-Hell -And-Back-Reliability" you've come to expect from Sig Sauer.

On a personal note, I really like this pistol. It has a bobbed no snag hammer design and the smoothest D.A.O. trigger pull I have ever felt on any semi- auto pistol. 

Oh, and it's a Sig... Enough Said.

title: Want To Buy:  Boxer-primed brass: 7.62x38R/54R...
postcontent:
7.65 Argentine, 6.5 & 7.7 Jap also. 
Prefer once-fired, but it isn't essential; must be usable boxer-primed brass.
Prvi Partizan, Winchester, Norma or other headstamps acceptable. Deliver to me and I'll pay 25 cents a piece. 100 pieces maximum for each rifle caliber: 7.62x54R, Japanese and 7.65 Argentine. Will take up to 300 pieces of 7.62x38R. I think Prvi Partizan is about the only boxer-primed brass available in 38R.
I'm not flush with cash, so don't max out on one shipment. A full small USPS box will be worthwhile, even if it's only 150 pieces total.

FWIW, I will consider berdan-primed brass cases (rifle), as long as they utilize the .217" primer. I'll only pay 12.5 cents for these.

title: For Sale/Trade:  TACTICAL SHOOTING AND BUG OUT GLOVES!!!
postcontent:
NO BUG OUT BAG IS COMPLETE WITHOUT A PAIR OF THESE! In an emergency, your hands are the first tool you will use! Think of all the things you can come in contact with in an emergency, broken glass, twisted steel, splintered wood, hot surfaces. The list has no end! You may be tough, but an infected cut can be disastrous when there are no hospitals to go to! Buy a pair today and be ready when the SHTF. These are brand new first quality. Features include padded leather palms and rubber finger and knuckle guards on the top. They will keep your hands scratch and cut free! They make awesome shooting gloves. No more cold, numb fingers getting scraped and cut! These also make excellent work gloves too! I have all sizes. Payment through PayPal is fast and secure. Shipping is FREE!!! Because I sell so many of these, I'm not able to drive all over the country to deliver them face to face. I use PayPal because it is a secure method that protects you as a buyer and me as a seller. If you are not willing to purchase these this way, then please do not waste my time or yours. It's cheaper to mail them than to drive 30 miles one way. I've had several folks back out of a purchase because they didn't feel comfortable. I understand this and I am not offended by it at all. But this is not a scam. If you send me money via PayPal, you WILL get your gloves. I have sold these from California to New Jersey to Afghanistan and everywhere in between without a single disappointed buyer. They are sent via USPS with tracking. If they don't arrive, I'll send you another pair or a refund. These retail at over $30.00 Be prepared for an immediate response because I respond to emails as soon as I get them. For an extra sweet deal, buy 3 pairs in one order and get them all for only $40.00! They don't all have to be the same size if you wish to purchase a pair as a gift for a friend.

UPDATE: This is from a customer who bought a pair of these for his brother who is a U.S. Navy SEAL currently deployed:

-My brother informed me that your gloves held up in combat without any glitches. I guess you can say combat proven. Thanks again.

title: For Sale:  SCAMMER ALERT: FOR SALE: FRANCHI SPAS 15 UNFIRED W/FOUR (4) MAGAZINES
postcontent:
Scammers ad below: 
http://www.armslist.com/posts/2713932/harrisburg-pennsylvania-rifles-for-sale--franchi-spas-15-unfired-w-four--4--magazines

FOR SALE: FRANCHI SPAS 15 UNFIRED W/FOUR (4) MAGAZINES

Price: $ 2,550 Seller: Private Party Account:Unregistered Listings by this user
Listed On:Wednesday, February 19, 2014Listed In:RiflesLocation: Harrisburg, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania - Map
Action: Semi-automatic Firearm Type: Rifle Flag |  Edit | Favorite 
Unfired FRANCHI SPAS 15, which Has the Original Hang-Tag. Approximately 230 units of the SPAS 15 were imported into the USA in Mid-1989. Shortly thereafter, Importation of the SPAS 15 was Banned by Executive Decree. According to F.I.E. Corp., the former importer, fewer then 190 units made it into the hands of firearms collectors. SPAS 15's all came with an internal receiver shock absorber which would dry up and disintegrate over time, even if the gun was never fired. You can read about all this at Chris's SPAS Site. http://spas12.com/index.htm. I had the receiver shock absorber in this SPAS 15 replaced with a New Polyethylene Shock Absorber by a qualified gunsmith. The Gun comes with Four (4) Magazines, three (3) have the original paper wrap. It also comes with an Original SPAS 15 Manual, SPAS Tool, and a Very Rare SPAS 15 Italian Military Tactical Sling. Few minor handling marks. Shipping is $85.00, Ground, Insured


Scammer took a break from playing with himself.

Hijacked from Gunbroker,,,  http://www.gunbroker.com/Auction/ViewItem.aspx?Item=384837114

I have for sale my FN Herstal Mk 16 Standard. It comes with an EOTech holographic sight and an EO Tech tripler, as well as forward broom handle. This weapon has fired less than 500 rounds and I am selling it as I prefer my Mk 17.

-Rifle comes with eight mags, the painted factory 30-round mag, a windowed 30-round PMag, a 10-round mag, and five unopened gray 30-round M16 mags.

I still have about 120 left and most were shot through the Mk 16 that I have listed, so that puts it in the mid 300's or so, which is negligible when you consider the 20,000+ round rating of the chrome lined barrel. 

-This rifle does not come with a case, but I do have the original factory box that will come with it if you would like.

-The rifle is in pristine condition, no marks, scratches, gouges, blemishes, or any other kind of damage except for the marks left on the casing deflector from fired rounds. Even that is quite minimal with so few rounds having been fired from it. 

-The same pristine condition applies to the optics. 

-The holo sight is EO Tech's 517 and is less than six months old and in pristine condition. 

-The EO Tech 3x magnifier is mounted on a Samson Quickflip and is about a year old and is in pristine condition as well. 

-This rifle is stored in a dehumidified gun safe when not in use, and is handled appropriately when used. As such, every part on this rifle is in nearly brand new condition.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Indiana Deer Legal Remington Model 700  350 JR
postcontent:
Two years ago it was illegal to hunt in Indiana with a rifle like this.
 Last year Indiana changed the casing length to 1.8 inches.  I have a gunsmith
 CF Gunworks LLC  that took  the 350 Remington Magnum  and shortened that casing to 1.8 inches
 Which is what this cartridge now is. You can’t  buy this ammo or the gun ,they 
 have to be custom made which is why they are expensive. The .357 and .44 magnums are just another example of Indiana Deer Legal cartridges that you can use. This is a High Powered Rifle that has been modified to meet Indiana specs and requirements . This rifle is 100 % legal to hunt with in Indiana .
Don’t wait for Deer season to decide you want one, you won’t be able to. This is someone’s chance to own
a very nice Indiana Deer Legal High Powered Rifle of which only a hand full are available.

I have a custom built Remington Model 700 That was a 350 Remington Magnum
it has been shortened to 1.8 inch. Indiana Deer Legal casing
the factory barrel has been bedded and set back to shorten the chamber.
It comes with Redding Dies that have been ground to match. 
I have brass and about 30rds of ammo that was made by C F Gunworks.
It is toped off with a leupold 3x9.
This rifle killed 3 deer at over 300yds this past season. It is amazing!!
I would like $1600 with scope or $1400 without.

This Rifle was custom built to Indiana Specs!!!!! And is referred to as a 350 JR
 This cartridge is modeled after the Remington 350 Magnum. They shorten the case
 to 1.8 inches, I took a picture so you can see the cartridge, bullet is 200grn
and clearly meets Indiana guide lines. I hope this helps with the confusion. 
Certain rifles like the .357 magnum or .44 magnum can be bought at walmart
and are perfectly legal. Indiana says you can't go below .357 magnum. This rifle can't
be bought at WalMart they have to be custom made which the price reflects

title: For Sale/Trade:  Troy Delta rail
postcontent:
The Troy Industries Delta Battlerail is a free-float drop in rail that installs easily. The Delta rail is a two-piece customizable rail designed for rifles with a carbine length gas system. The rail has a cut-out to accommodate the standard front sight. There are two push button quick detach sling sockets located on the left and right sides of the rail at the front sight location. The rail system has a built in top rail section and a short rail section underneath the front sight post, with the option to add customizable rail sections (sold separately) where needed to accomodate the shooter's choice of tactical accessories. Installation of the rail does not require the removal of the barrel nut, delta ring, or front sight. The Delta rail will give you more room to mount foregrips, lights and other accessories than the standard drop-in carbine rails, and does not require specialized tools to disassemble the upper or an upgraded gas block to gain the extra rail space. 
No box
Very light wear 

180 obo
